refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A Group surrounds several related items. Usually, they are grouped because they are mutually exclusive. The user is expected to select one of the items.

refsection.title: Processing expectations
refsection.para: The additional processing expectations of a Group are significant. For a complete discussion, see CmdSynopsis.

listitem.para: Multiple arguments within a group are considered exclusive and are separated by vertical bars.

Brackets are used to distinguish between optional, required, or plain arguments. Usually square brackets are placed around optional arguments, [-f | -g], and curly brackets are placed around required arguments, {-f | -g}. Plain arguments are required, but are not decorated with brackets.
Repeatable arguments are followed by an ellipsis.
